mods.abstract: Male adult, nut head with covered wire body, bean hands and feet, painted features, black felt hat and white hair, red check cotton shirt, red solid scarp, grey check cotton pants with one side suspender, holding long wooden gun, stands on green round wooden-plate, hand-made, typed and mounted on the side of the wooden-plate 'WEE MOUNTAIN FOLKS'. Accompanying information describes that dolls have been made from every conceivable material. Climate has much to do with the stuff from which a doll is fashioned, in ancient days there were dolls made of wood, bone, ivory, leather, linen, papyrus, wax, leaves, shells, seeds, sponge, beads, fur, egg shells, beeswax, nuts, and corn-husk. The dolls are being made in the mountains of the Carolinas, Kentucky, and Missouri. These two nut dolls were made in the mountains.""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
